intro: Eriocaulon tepicanum, commonly known as the narrowleaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its reproductive structures are monoecious, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Eriocaulon tepicanum plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
